item.title: Frostpunk 2: Synergy Bonuses & District Placement Explained
item.description:
Quick Links

  • What Is District Synergy In Frostpunk 2?
  • Types Of Synergy In Frostpunk 2
  • How To Get Synergy Bonuses In Frostpunk 2

Frostpunk 2 players must build and maintain a variety of districts in order to supply New London with crucial resources. While these districts work in most circumstances, they operate more efficiently and result in fewer negative consequences when players use the Synergy system.

However, the synergy system is not explained in detail anywhere in the game's tutorials. As such, which districts and hubs have specific effect is difficult for new players to figure out. Keep reading for details on all of the most common synergy modifiers for Districts and Hubs in Frostpunk 2 , as well as how to best utilize them.

What Is District Synergy In Frostpunk 2?

District Synergy is a mechanic in Frostpunk 2 that gives modifiers to a district depending on where it is placed . A number of things can effect district synergy, including terrain, hubs, buildings, and other districts. Synergy modifiers can be positive or negative, so players need to be aware of different synergy effects for the best city performance.

Types Of Synergy In Frostpunk 2

Synergy modifiers can affect most game mechanics, falling into one of several categories.

  • Workforce Required
  • Heating Required
  • Workplace Efficiency
  • Squalor
  • Disease

The most common synergy is a reduction in the amount of heating required, as this bonus is available to districts whenever they are placed close together or in natural dips in terrain. However, players will also occasionally encounter an increase in the heating required modifier, most notably when building on the top of a hill.

Districts & Hubs That Give Common Synergy Bonuses

Synergy Effect

Districts

Heating Requirement Reduced

  • Any District
  • The Generator
  • Heating Hub

Workforce Required

  • Fuel Stockpile Hub
  • Food Stockpile Hub
  • Materials Stockpile Hub
  • Goods Stockpile Hub
  • Air Transport Hub

Workplace Efficiency

  • Rail Hub

Squalor Increased

  • Industrial Districts (when placed near housing)

Disease Increased

  • Food Districts (when placed near housing, industrial, or excavation districts)

How To Get Synergy Bonuses In Frostpunk 2

In order to receive a given synergy modifier, a district must have at least three tiles in range of the other building/terrain . Placing more than three tiles in the range of a single building has no further effect. However, bonuses of the same type stack when received from different sources. As a result, players can build housing districts to receive two required heating reductions and thus buff the required heating to zero. Alternatively, players can accidentally increase their squalor by placing a Housing District between two Industrial Districts.

Costs of districts cannot be reduced below zero, so there are (for instance) no further bonuses for sheltering a housing district further when the heating required is already at zero. As a result, it is usually better to avoid more than three tiles in proximity, ensuring room for more districts with good synergy bonuses.

How To Check All Active Synergy Bonuses

Active Synergy Effects can be checked in one of two ways. Players can either hold down the 8 key in order to view the building effects tab. Alternatively, every effect currently active in a district can be seen by clicking on it and then hovering over the icons under Area Effect.

item.title: Black Myth: Wukong - Best Ways To Increase Stamina Recovery Rate
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Everlasting Vigor is a crucial early-game skill with low spark cost and noticeable stamina recovery boost.
  • Swift Bat Spirit Vessel offers a moderate stamina recovery increase and valuable passive effects in combat.
  • Plantain Fan is a powerful late-game vessel with a devastating AoE attack and valuable stamina recovery boost.

Stamina is a precious resource in Black Myth: Wukong . It depletes quickly whether attacking, running, jumping, or attacking most of all. It's one of the most valuable tools in The Destined One's arsenal. In the early game, Stamina Recovery Rate is an essential stat for players to dedicate some of those precious sparks to â€” especially if they're looking to take down that pesky Wandering Wight.

A solid Stamina Recovery Rate is crucial for new players starting their journey westward in Black Myth: Wukong . It forms a strong foundation for any viable build in the game, enabling players to replenish their stamina much faster after it's been depleted. This allows The Destined One to get right back to doing what they do best: hitting things with a pole. Let's look at how players can get their Stamina Recovery Rate up to scratch.

8 Everlasting Vigor

Get It Early & Use It

Skill Tree

Foundation

Required Upgrades

Endurance

Spark Cost

1

Effect

Slightly increases Stamina Recovery Rate when depleted.

This is the earliest way players can improve their Stamina Recovery Rate. Being a foundation skill, Everlasting Vigor can essentially be unlocked with the player's second Spark. It's hard to miss, but it can easily go overlooked given how much more appealing and flashy some of the other early-game skills can look.

Though not as 'cool' as other skills players can level into in their early hours of play, it's vital. It has a low unlock cost and is easy to obtain. Even though it's not a significant improvement, it's a noticeable start.

7 Deep Breath

Fantastic Foundation Skill

Skill Tree

Foundation

Requirements

Character Level 45

Spark Cost

2

Effect

Each Talent Level moderately increases Stamina Recovery Rate

Despite not being available until further into The Destined One's journey, Deep Breath will be one of the main ways players will upgrade their Stamina Recovery Rate, especially in the later parts of the game.

It can be upgraded up to six times, though each time this talent is awakened, it will cost players 2 sparks. It can become slightly more costly in the long run, but remember, Sparks can be returned to the player at any time, so if a specific build isn't working out, it can always be reset.

6 Swift Bat Spirit

Weaker Spirit, Powerful Passive

How To Obtain

Near the Valley of Despair Shrine, beyond the First Prince of Flowing Sands arena. Keep heading through the cave until reaching a narrow hallway with a crack in the wall that the Destined One can squeeze through. The Swift Bat enemy will appear, and its Spirit can be absorbed and equipped upon its defeat.

Equipped Effect

Moderately Increases Stamina Recovery Rate (+10)

Despite not being the most 'viable' in its offensive capabilities as some of the more powerful spirits players will have attained up to this point, the equipped effect is undoubtedly vital for those looking to bolster their Stamina Recovery.

Swift Bat is the best spirit for players looking for the least amount of downtime against the disparaging Tiger Vanguard. The passive boost to Stamina Recovery is great, and the Spirit Vessel attack is a solid bonus for that extra bit of damage.

5 Celestial Pills

Costly But Effective

Though players will need to jump through a few hoops in Chapter 2 to unlock Xu Dog's crafting station, Celestial Pills are by far the easiest way to increase their Stamina Recovery Rate.

Players will need Mind Cores to unlock them, a valuable resource in Black Myth: Wukong, and Celestial Pills become increasingly expensive the more players wish to upgrade a certain skill. Xu Dog's crafting station will most likely become the go-to for players wishing to upgrade this stat as they find themselves traveling further west. Though mind cores are rare, they can, at certain points, be purchased from Shrines or Xu Dog himself - for a price.

4 Fine China Tea Bowl Curios

Much Needed Reward For The Pagoda Realm

How To Obtain

Along the main path of the Lower Pagoda Realm in Chapter 3, just past the long staircase leading up, there's a small chest containing this Curio.

Equipped Effect

Moderately Increases Stamina Recovery Rate

Those waking up in the deeply-stressful Pagoda Realm will no doubt be scrambling to get out as quickly as possible, given the constantly shrinking health bar and a myriad of Yaoguais that seem never-ending.

Though not exactly 'hidden' by any means, with just how stressful this leg of the journey west is, many players can overlook the Fine China Tea Bowls . For those that do find it, however, it's an incredibly valuable Curio that deserves an equipped slot for its effects on Stamina Recovery Rate.

3 Focused Breath

Crucial For Late-Game Builds

Skill Tree

Foundation

Requirements

  1. Endurance
  2. Everlasting Vigor/Deft Evasion
  3. Composure
  4. Featherlight

Spark Cost

1

Effect

Each talent level considerably increases Stamina Recovery Rate when Health is above half.

Focused Breath is great for keeping the pressure on at the start of fights. When The Destined One's health is above half, there is a noticeable increase in the speed of the player's Stamina Recovery Rate.

Though the effect obviously dissipates once health is lowered below 50%, a few swigs of a Gourd can get this effect straight back into full swing. Anyone looking to get the most out of their Stamina should dedicate their trusty Sparks to awakening this talent.

2 Non-Void Spirit

Dodging Isn't Always Easy

How To Obtain

Defeat the Non-Void just beyond New Thunderclap Temple. Players will need to use the Snow Fox Brush, which can be found on a body in the Forest of Felicity, in order to make the Non-Void hostile.

Equipped Effect

Recover a moderate amount of Stamina upon being hit.

This Spirit's equipped effect is incredibly useful for those times when players take a few more hits than they may have initially bargained for.

Whether it's a quick rebuttal attack or just dodging away, the Non-Void Spirit will no doubt bring some fights back from the brink, providing The Destined One with that much-needed bit of extra stamina. Though it's not recommended for players to take damage, it's unavoidable; at least this Spirit softens the blow.

1 Plantain Fan

Devastating Vessel, Invaluable Passive

How To Attain

The Plantain Fan is a Vessel rewarded to players upon completion of Chapter 5.

Active Effect

Conjure a tornado that can attack and immobilize enemies caught in it's AoE.

Equipped Effect

Moderately Increases Stamina Recovery Rate.

One of the most powerful Vessels that players will obtian along their journey in Black Myth: Wukong is the Plantain Fan . Though not usable until the final chapter of the game, its attack becomes invaluable against bosses, essentially stun-locking them upon use, allowing The Destined One to get some valuable attacks in.

The Equipped effect acts as a powerful buff to Stamina Recovery Rate , too. Seeing as players don't get many opportunities to increase this stat, the Plantain Fan is no doubt one of the most powerful tools in The Destined One's arsenal, and there's very little reason to not have it equipped the majority of the time.

item.title: Final Fantasy 17 Needs to Set One Trend From FF16 in Stone
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Final Fantasy 17 likely won't be announced soon, but it could benefit from Final Fantasy 16's innovations.
  • Final Fantasy 17 should consider adding an animal companion like Torgal from Final Fantasy 16.
  • To stand out, Final Fantasy 17 should ensure any animal companion is unique and significant to the story.

The next mainline Final Fantasy game has yet to be announced, but given there are usually several years between games and Final Fantasy 16 only launched last year, it will likely still be at least another year or two before anything about Final Fantasy 17 surfaces. Regardless, it's worth considering how Final Fantasy 16 's drastic shift in formula might affect the next game, as there are plenty of things it could draw inspiration from that have been both loved and hated by the fan base.

Despite Final Fantasy 16 's divisiveness, some parts of it are universally received. One feature, in particular, is something Final Fantasy 17 shouldn't hesitate to copy, as it is beloved at large by the community and should therefore be put up for consideration as a new Final Fantasy staple.

Final Fantasy 17's Protagonist Needs an Animal Companion Like Final Fantasy 16's Torgal

Torgal Is a Fan-Favorite Animal Companion From Final Fantasy 16

The Final Fantasy series and its protagonists have seen no shortage of animal companions, but no installment has implemented one quite like Final Fantasy 16 . Torgal is Clive Rosfield's lovable, furry wolf companion who remains by his side throughout the majority of the game, assisting him in combat and occasionally chiming in with a bark when spoken to. What sets Torgal apart is his unbridled loyalty to the protagonist, and his ability to fight without direction â€” although players can still issue commands to Torgal during combat if they wish. Since his introduction, he has become a fan-favorite character, so the only way forward seems to be to include a similar companion in the next game.

Final Fantasy 17's Protagonist Should Have Their Own Torgal-Like Animal Companion

Now that Final Fantasy 16 has broken ground for it, Final Fantasy 17 shouldn't forego giving its protagonist an adorable animal companion like Torgal. This would give players another round of what they got with Torgal in Final Fantasy 16 , as well as potentially expound on Torgal's unique additions to Final Fantasy 16 's gameplay.

The only issue Final Fantasy 17 would need to resolve is the fact that many fans weren't happy with Clive being the only playable character in Final Fantasy 16 , and that's likely the only way the next installment could get a Torgal-like companion to work. If the next Final Fantasy went back to a traditional party setup where the player controls each character, a new animal companion might be nothing more than another Final Fantasy 10 Khumari or Final Fantasy 7 Cait Sith. As such, Final Fantasy 17 would need to lean into what makes Torgal a unique animal companion in the series.

Firstly, Torgal doesn't speak, nor does he walk upright, unlike almost every other animal companion in the Final Fantasy series. He is, in every way, an animal, and that is ultimately what sets him apart from the rest. Since Torgal is strictly an animal, players can bond with him in a much different way than they can with others like Final Fantasy 7 's Red XIII or Final Fantasy 9 's Freya. Secondly, players can complete special quests for Torgal in Final Fantasy 16 that strengthen Clive's bond with him and unlock his potential in combat.

This is highly unlike what players might experience with other animal companions in the series, and it is something Final Fantasy 17 would need to consider, should it continue the trend that its predecessor started.

It's unclear whether Final Fantasy 17 's protagonist will get their own animal companion, or whether it will adopt any of Final Fantasy 16 's features at all. Nevertheless, as Torgal has proven to be a fan-favorite companion among the Final Fantasy community, it would be a shame not to include a similar character in the next installment. Of course, Final Fantasy 17 will need to first consider what it is that makes Torgal unique among the rest.

item.title: Xbox Game Pass Day One Game Is Already Getting Rave Reviews
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Frostpunk 2 is now available for Xbox Game Pass Ultimate and PC Game Pass members at no additional cost.
  • Set in an alternate history, Frostpunk 2 challenges players to manage resources and navigate conflicts in a snowbound wasteland.
  • With a campaign mode that takes 8-10 hours to beat, Frostpunk 2 also offers endless replayability with its Utopia Builder.

Frostpunk 2 , the long-awaited sequel to 2018â€™s award-winning city-building survival game, is now available on PC for Xbox Game Pass subscribers to enjoy. Given the recent changes to Microsoftâ€™s subscription service, only Ultimate and PC Game Pass members will be able to access the game at no additional cost, though it is also available for purchase.

11 Bit Studiosâ€™ Frostpunk 2 is set in an alternate history early 20th century, 30 years after an apocalyptic blizzard has plunged the world into a never-ending volcanic winter. The first game had the player leading a group of survivors and establishing a stronghold in the harsh, wintery environment. In the sequel, the people have grown more confident and their contentious natures have begun to rise to the surface as their ambitions threaten the stability of the city of New London.

Frostpunk 2 will be the fifth title to launch day one on Xbox Game Pass in September. Though the game is in development for Xbox Series X/S, Frostpunk 2 won't release on consoles until 2025. So, for now at least, only the PC version will be available for Game Pass subscribers. Thatâ€™s not necessarily a bad thing, because the highly detailed city-builder is very well suited for control with a mouse and keyboard.

Xbox Game Pass Titles Confirmed for September 2024

Star Trucker

Available now

Console, PC

Day-one release

Age of Mythology: Retold

Available now

Console, PC, Cloud

Day-one release

Expeditions: A MudRunner Game

Available now

Console, PC

Riders Republic

Available now

Console, PC

Train Sim World 5

Available now

Console, PC, Cloud

Day-one release

Wargroove 2/td>

Available now

Console, PC, Cloud

Day-one console release

Frostpunk 2

Available now

PC

Day-one release

Ara: History Untold

September 24

PC

Day-one release

In Frostpunk 2, players will have to deal with the constant needs of a growing population in the middle of a snowbound wasteland. There will be shortages of food, energy, and heating resources, as well as a constant need to expand housing and existing services like medicine and religion. At the same time, where there are people, there will be conflict. Various factions begin to form in Frostpunk 's New London, each with their own ideas of whatâ€™s important for the budding metropolis to focus on.

The campaign mode in Frostpunk 2 takes 8 to 10 hours to beat, and the game also features a sandbox mode called Utopia Builder that allows players to select their starting communities and factions. The goal will be to simply survive for as long as possible. This mode expands on what was available in the original game, says 11 Studios, and paves the way for endless replayability. Frostpunk 2 already has a â€œMightyâ€ rating on OpenCritic, with an average critic score of 86, so Xbox Game Pass Ultimate and PC subscribers have plenty to be excited about.

However, thereâ€™s even more to look forward to, as Oxide Gamesâ€™ Ara: History Untold will be launching day one on Xbox Game Pass on September 24. The turn-based strategy game also takes players to an alternate history, where they will build monuments, develop cultures, and lead a nation to the â€œpinnacles of human achievement.â€

item.title: Dead Rising Deluxe Remaster: How Long To Beat
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How Long Is The Main Story Of Dead Rising Deluxe Remaster
  • How Long To 100% Dead Rising Deluxe Remaster

Dead Rising Deluxe Remaster has multiple game modes for players to complete on top of the main story during the 72-hour game mode players will start out with. 72-Hours is the main story and overall focus of the game, but there is still a lot more to do after completing it.

All game modes will still revolve around Frank West surviving in the zombie-infested mall, but later game modes will give more freedom which also is great for players trying to get all the achievements. Here we'll get into how long players can expect to spend in the game depending on what you're looking to get out of it.

How Long Is The Main Story Of Dead Rising Deluxe Remaster

Dead Rising Deluxe Remaster's main story mode is the 72-Hour mode which functions on an in-game clock of 72 hours. Outside of menus and cutscenes, the timer will continue to progress in real-time, with every few minutes being an in-game hour. Because of this, players can expect to spend roughly six hours on the 72-hour mode of the game if they play every in-game minute.

While that is the most you can get out of a playthrough, there are ways for you to speed up time and make a playthrough shorter should you want to quickly get to one of the multiple endings. Depending on your choices, there are multiple endings to get, leading to a decent amount of replayability or at least saving and going back to make different decisions.

How Long To 100% Dead Rising Deluxe Remaster

After completing the 72-hour mode, players will unlock Overtime mode, which adds an additional 24 hours of in-game time and another 2 or 3 hours of playtime. After completing Overtime, you'll unlock Infinite Mode, which adds an unlimited number of hours of playtime if you want . For those trying to complete every achievement in the game, there is one for surviving seven days on Infinite Mode, meaning an additional 14-ish hours depending on how you play those days to get the trophy.

On top of those survival-focused trophies, many are fairly easy to get and will be done naturally while you play each game mode, with the leftovers being easily finished during the seven days in Infinite Mode. The ability to fast-forward time does make the time-specific trophies easier to get, and your overall playtime can vary greatly using that feature if you're able to get all the other trophies quickly.
